item.title: Stabilizing the Dump Shell
item.description: Hello All, This is my first blog that explains how to stabilize the shell in Linux. While playing CTF Challenges, it is often to spawn a reverse shell on the target machine. Other than an ssh shell, every shell is a dump which often kills the reverse shell and this shell doesn’t give you the proper shell functionalities like tab completion, “su” command, clear the terminal, etc. Sometimes, pressing “ctrl+c” completely kills your reverse shell.
